channel.title: My first attempt at making an item
channel.description:
[img]http://i909.photobucket.com/albums/ac299/yum_yum_sauc/sword.jpg[/img] [img]http://i909.photobucket.com/albums/ac299/yum_yum_sauc/swords.jpg[/img] It is based on the sword between the rune and scape in the logo. I can't seem to convert it to a .dat file, so if someone would be willing to help there i will do the ints and release it.
to help me, my msn is kmtimekeeper@gmail.com
thanks =)

item.title: My first attempt at making an item
item.dc:creator: @yum_yum_sauc yum yum sauc
item.description:
@yum_yum_sauc wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:7, topic:355844”][quote author=yum yum sauc link=topic=452389.msg3315015#msg3315015 date=1282251036]

Not bad, for a trace. Try working with primitives, I’m sure you’ll find they work easier to your liking.

Do you happen to know how I can get it to work when i put it into the datmaker? It keeps yelling at me saying it has lines and then looks like my image just all pieced up. Do you know what I am doing wrong?
[/quote]

in metaseq, go to edit > select all, then go to selected (or object, cant remember) > delete lines

after that, if your model is still in quads, go to edit > select all, selected > triangulate selected faces.

save and then try to open with datmaker[/quote]
TYSVM!!!

Read full topic
item.source: My first attempt at making an item

item.title: My first attempt at making an item
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“yum yum sauc, post:6, topic:355844”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=452389.msg3315014#msg3315014 date=1282250926]
Not bad, for a trace. Try working with primitives, I’m sure you’ll find they work easier to your liking.
[/quote]
Do you happen to know how I can get it to work when i put it into the datmaker? It keeps yelling at me saying it has lines and then looks like my image just all pieced up. Do you know what I am doing wrong?[/quote]

in metaseq, go to edit > select all, then go to selected (or object, cant remember) > delete lines

after that, if your model is still in quads, go to edit > select all, selected > triangulate selected faces.

save and then try to open with datmaker

Read full topic

item.description:
@yum_yum_sauc wrote:

reyx7:

Not bad, for a trace. Try working with primitives, I’m sure you’ll find they work easier to your liking.

Do you happen to know how I can get it to work when i put it into the datmaker? It keeps yelling at me saying it has lines and then looks like my image just all pieced up. Do you know what I am doing wrong?
